column2: MINNESOTA DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: on the left shoulder of the road.
column6: near the left edge of the road.
column8: near the right curb or edge of the road.

column2: 2. This sign warns that:
column8: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.

column2: 3. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column4: The use of headlight is required by law.
column8: Reduced visibility.

column2: 4. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column8: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.
column10: from a one-way street into a one-way street.

column2: 5. This sign means:
column8: The traffic signal is not operational

column2: 6. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
column8: on the right.

column2: 7. When the driver behind you wants to pass, you should:
column4: slow down to allow room for the other driver to complete the pass safely.
column8: change lanes.

column2: 8. When you drive near parks and playgrounds, you should expect children:
column4: to stop at the curb before crossing the street.
column6: not to cross unless they are with an adult.
column8: to know when it is safe to cross.
column10: to suddenly run into the street.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: You can travel in either direction in this lane
column8: Divided highway ahead

column2: 10. If an aggressive driver is behind you:
column4: try to get out of the aggressive driver’s way.
column6: increase you speed and flash your brake lights.
column8: slow down and confront the aggressive driver.
column10: sound your horn and move to the left lane.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column8: Wrong Way

column2: 12. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.
column6: There are four stop signs at the intersection.
column8: Traffic from all four directions must stop.

column2: 13. A driver should be extra alert for motorcyclists, bicycles and pedestrians. Why?
column8: They are hard to see in traffic.

column2: 14. When meeting a car with blinding headlights, you should:
column4: use your emergency flashers to warn the other driver.
column6: look toward the right side of the road.
column8: dim your lights, then speed up and pass quickly.
column10: look toward the left side of the road.

column2: 15. Drivers under 21 years of age are considered to be driving under the influence if their blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is:
column8: .08% or higher.

column2: 16. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column6: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.
column10: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column8: Railroad crossing

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column8: Right turn permitted on red light

column2: 19. The sign in the picture:
column4: means that you need to stop.
column6: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column8: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column10: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.

column2: 20. This sign means:
column8: narrow bridge ahead.

column2: 21. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column4: enter one of the blind spots and wait.
column8: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column6: Slow down and yield to traffic on main road when merging
column8: Always come to a complete stop
column10: You must come to a complete stop and yield right-of-way

column2: 23. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column6: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.
column8: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.

column2: 24. A traffic light shows both a red light and a green arrow. The driver may not turn in the direction of the arrow until the red light has changed.
25. When a stop is required at an intersection with no stop line or crosswalk:
column4: Drivers should stop at the point nearest the intersecting roadway where the driver has a view of approaching traffic on the intersecting roadway before actually entering the roadway.
column6: Drivers are required to slow down to make sure crossing traffic is clear.
column8: Drivers should stop only at a place where the driver can see at least 100 feet on either side.
column10: Drivers are not required to stop.

column2: 26. Tailgating:
column6: can frustrate other drivers and make them angry.
column8: helps reduce traffic congestion.
column10: cannot result in a traffic citation.

column2: 27. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column6: enter the intersection and then stop.
column8: slow down and enter the intersection.

column2: 28. When exiting a highway, you should slow down:
column4: once you have moved into the exit lane.
column6: once you see the toll booth.
column8: when you first see the exit sign.
column10: before moving into the exit lane.

column2: 29. After stopping for a school bus that is unloading children you should:
column6: watch for children walking along the side of the road.
column8: wait at least 4 minutes.

column2: 30. This road sign means:
column6: A road joins from the right
column8: “Y” intersection ahead

column2: 31. A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
column4: Passing is permitted on the side of the solid yellow line
column6: Passing is not permitted in either direction
column8: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction
column10: Passing is permitted on the side of the broken yellow line

column2: 32. This road sign means:
column8: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column2: 33. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column8: Stop sign

column2: 34. Smoking while driving:
column8: is distracting.

column2: 35. This sign means:
column4: you must yield to the traffic signal ahead.
column8: Traffic signal ahead
column10: The traffic signal ahead is out of order

column2: 36. Yellow traffic signs:
column4: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column8: warn drivers.

column2: 37. This sign indicates:
column8: Merging traffic

column2: 38. If your turn signals fail, you should use _____ to indicate your intention to turn.
column8: hand signals

column2: 39. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column4: Look to the left and right for other traffic.
column8: Merge left.
column10: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.

column2: 40. A merge sign means drivers should be prepared to change lanes or allow other traffic to come into their lane.
